manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 1TB Mfi Certified Portable External Solid State Drive for iPhone/iPad/Mac/PC/Laptops/ USB-C Android devices. ySky external Solid State Drive will help you conveniently save and back up Photos/Videos/Music/Files/Contacts from your phones and computer; It's able to be directly used on cellphone, which is the main difference between this new Solid State Drive and other common hard drives. Advatanges: *1TB brand SSD Built-in.high speed on computers and macbook . *One-touch backup your Photos/Videos from your iPhone/iPad. *APP Management on iOS devices *Data Encryption will protect your privacy. *MFi Certified by A-pple Company with Original latest chip . *Mini portable,Plug and Play on the Move. * Widely Compatibility with iPhone/iPad/Mac/Android/PC.

One-click Backup for iPhone iPad ySky 1T SSD will help you solve the problem of short of storage space; It can one touch back up all your photos&videos, music ,files ,contacts from your phone; Extend the storage space of your cellphone's capacity up to 1TB immediately. and Save cloud service monthly fee. Mini unique metal design Super mini and easy to use. Using this phone hard drive disk is also very easy, it's kind of like using a USB flash; Just simply connect it with your phone or computer, select the files you want to move, then copy and paste. 1T Portable External SSD The size of this phone SSD is like a samll power bank, very easy to carry .

Absolutely Safe Data with Cable to transfer This external drive doesn't require wifi, bluetooth, network connection to run, it can run only by cables, so your privacy and datas will be fully protected and totally safe. MFi Certified by A-pple company Original Lightning port from A-pple company ,Just simply Plug the MFi certified Portablet SSD drive into your phones or computer, drag and drop. all the precious photos and videos always belong to you ! Faster Speed on Macbook and PCs Higher Speed on Macbook,computers and android phones than HDD drive. Write and read speed about 250MB/S depends on your PC Environment.

Widely Compatible with Different Devices Transferring photos and videos from one phone to another is always difficult, especially when they are different phone brands; Now, this phone hard drive will provide a better solution for transferring your files; Just simply copy your photos and videos to the harddrive and paste it on another phone, that's it, file transfer is done Besides being used for iPhone iPad and USB-C Phones &tablets , this photo stick drive can also be used as an ordinary external hard drive for Mackbook,computer and laptop. such as i-Phone 14 / 13/12/11, 13/12/11 Pro, 14/13/12/11 Pro Max, 14/13/12 Mini, SE, XR, XS, XS Max, X, 8 /7/6S/6 Plus, 8/7/6S/6, 6/5S, iPad 5/6/7/8/9, Mini 2/3/4/5/6 iPad Air-Serie, iPad Pro-Series,Mackbook,Windows PC,USB-C phones and tablets.only one Drive, suitable for your work and Family.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars SSD with Lots of Wires
reviews.reviewText: This external hard drive does a good job of covering all the bases. It has ports for USB C and USB A for data transfer, as well as a micro USB port for power. I'm honestly not sure what the need for external power is for; after all this is a SSD, not spinning disk, so it's power requirements are minimal. I used this attached to my PC via USB C and no power, without issue. Maybe it is necessary for use with mobile? There are a ton of instructions, mostly having to do with using this with an Apple device. I don't have those, so cannot comment on its utility when it comes to that. For me, I am using this as a simple external hard drive, but love the fact it is solid state. No moving parts usually means much longer life. This is limited to exfat formatting, which is a bit of a downer. It says so in multiple locations, even on the drive itself. I guess it will give issues if formatted differently. Either way, this is a good pickup for what it does. I would imagine it works even better for Apple, as that is what it's marketed for and there are tons of instructions on how to integrate it into that ecosystem. Either way I like this drive!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good transfer rates.
reviews.reviewText: This external SSD is a high-capacity, portable storage solution that offers a multitude of features. It provides ample space for backing up photos, videos, music, and files.The SSD is Mfi certified, ensuring it works seamlessly with iPhone & iPad devices. It is also compatible with MacBook, Windows computers, and Android phones, making it a versatile choice for users with multiple devices.The metal design of the SSD not only gives it a sleek and modern look but also adds to its durability. This makes it a reliable choice for users who need to carry their data on the go.The drive come preformatted as exFat and should not be formatted to NTFS if used with a Windows PC as the performance will be very bad. The transfer rates of this drive were good for reads with an average of 250MBs+. The transfer rate for writes started off good and maintained 180-220MBs for about half the drive (~467GB) before falling down to an average of ~80MBs for the remainder of the drive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Back up button is grayed out.
reviews.reviewText: I am not sure if I am doing something wrong but I downloaded the app, connected to the phone and I can’t back up the pics. Not sure how to proceed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Looking for a good backup storage device for your photos?
reviews.reviewText: Looking for a good backup storage device?I’ve been using this ySky 1TB SSD to back up my photos on my iPhone, Chromebook, MacBook Pro, and Windows machines. It’s large and fast enough to backup my photo/video libraries that contain over 100GB. I reformatted the drive and the free space was 953.8MB in exFAT format. The unique shape makes it easy to find in my laptop bag and includes the cable for almost every device.RecommendedPros:-Works on Apple Macbook, IOS, Windows, and even Chromebooks-Size: Small and circular-1TB space: (See photos for free space after formatting).-Includes USB-C, USB-A, Micro USB, and even Lightning cables for backup-Feels solid and well built. It has tiny rubber feet, so it doesn’t slide around the deskCons:- None

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Noisy, bit toasty, ok speed, covered in fingerprints from the factory
reviews.reviewText: This thing looks like an old makeup compact. I say old because it was covered in fingerprints and scratches right out of the box. It looks like the last part of QA at the factory is handled by toddlers eating Cheetos.I went to test this and I noticed some odd things. First, my CrystalDiskMark had an anime girl on it, and second, this was only giving me USB 2.0 speeds. It's connected to a Thunderbolt 4 compatible USB-C port via what should have been a Thunderbolt 4 cable. It sure looked like the right cable, until I looked at the plug end and noticed it said 240w. That's not my Thunderbolt 4 cable. Hmm...anime girl...yep. My daughter stole my cable. So, if you get USB 2.0 (40MB/s) speed out of this, blame my daughter. Or your USB-C cable. One of the two. Remember, there are lots of USB-C cables out there that are USB 2.0. Those are typically charging cables. They may say 480Mbps somewhere on the packaging or on the listing. That's USB 2.0. Real world, it'll be 40MB/s....ish.After I recovered my good cable from my daughter's room (why she stole my Thunderbolt 4 cable to charge her phone, I'll never know) I set about testing this. The numbers aren't terrible. They aren't amazing, but they aren't terrible.This thing whines. I have no idea what's whining in there, but it's quite high pitched. I can hear it, but not as well as the kids in the house, who all heard it from across the room. I am become old, destroyer of La-Z-Boys.It gets pretty warm. It's not blazing hot, but it is warm when in use. Also, it's not super portable, considering you need to plug it into your device and into power. It doesn't have any kind of power pass through. Meaning, it won't charge your phone.I tested this on Windows 10 and Android 13. It worked just fine on both. I didn't have to do a thing to it on either. I just plugged it in and both immediately recognized it. I don't use Apple products. I have literally never owned anything made by Apple and I never will.It seems to be getting quieter with use. No idea why this thing was whining out of the box. Maybe it was angry about the greasy fingerprints from the factory.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love this portable drive. I was pleasantly surprised to see that there was actually more than 90% of available 1TB for use. I simply hooked it up to my Windows Laptop with the included USB cable and I was up and running. I could not do the same with my Android table and phone. Also, I could not evaluate the in or out transfer rates on the device. I can only evaluate it as a non-techy reviewer. The size and weight of this device is a huge selling point for me. All-in-all, I cannot fault this device for any objective reason. I'd say, go ahead and get it if you need an external SSD device of this size.
